@graph.caption: a loaf of flax seed bread on a wooden surface

@graph.name: Orange Apple Flax Seed Bread. - Vegan Richa
@graph.description: A fresh and zesty flax seed bread made with orange and apple. So delicious and easy to make at home. Vegan Recipe. Great for snacks or sandwiches.

@graph.name: Orange Apple Flaxseed Bread
@graph.description: A fresh and zesty flaxseed bread made with orange and apple. So delicious and easy to make at home. Vegan Recipe.
recipeIngredient: 1.5 teaspoon quick rise yeast and .5 teaspoon regular yeast

recipeInstructions.text: Warm the water and add yeast to it. Let sit for 10 minutes or until frothy.
recipeInstructions.name: Warm the water and add yeast to it. Let sit for 10 minutes or until frothy.

recipeInstructions.text: Puree the apple with little water, sugar and molasses.
recipeInstructions.name: Puree the apple with little water, sugar and molasses.

recipeInstructions.text: Grease the mixer bowl and add 3 cups (390g) bread flour, 1 cup (130g) whole wheat flour, salt, flax seed and mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: Grease the mixer bowl and add 3 cups (390g) bread flour, 1 cup (130g) whole wheat flour, salt, flax seed and mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the yeast mixture, marmalade, softened butter and lime juice and knead for 10-12 minutes( 2-3 minute batches with occasional scraping)
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the yeast mixture, marmalade, softened butter and lime juice and knead for 10-12 minutes( 2-3 minute batches with occasional scraping)

recipeInstructions.text: Add more water or flour if needed. The apple will make the dougg more moist with time, so try to keep the dough a little on the dry side.
recipeInstructions.name: Add more water or flour if needed. The apple will make the dougg more moist with time, so try to keep the dough a little on the dry side.

recipeInstructions.text: Place dough in well oiled container covered for 1.5 hours.
recipeInstructions.name: Place dough in well oiled container covered for 1.5 hours.

recipeInstructions.text: Punch it down and knead for a minute. Shape dough into a loaf by pulling on all sides and tucking under.
recipeInstructions.name: Punch it down and knead for a minute. Shape dough into a loaf by pulling on all sides and tucking under.

recipeInstructions.text: Place in bread pan, cover with kitchen towe and let rise for another 40 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Place in bread pan, cover with kitchen towe and let rise for another 40 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake at 375 degrees F for 45-50 minutes or until nice a brown and sounds hollow.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake at 375 degrees F for 45-50 minutes or until nice a brown and sounds hollow.

recipeInstructions.text: Bread will have a nice dark crumb, which will be a bit hard right out of the oven, but will soften as the bread cools. Slice after the loaf has cooled completely.
recipeInstructions.name: Bread will have a nice dark crumb, which will be a bit hard right out of the oven, but will soften as the bread cools. Slice after the loaf has cooled completely.
